description: With this sculpture, Estela Dagua reinterpreted the form of a jaguar-head kero—a kind of Inca drinking cup. Such keros were created centuries earlier by Inca artists after the Spanish invasion of their empire. Dagua's works include traditional Amazonian ceramic forms like this sculpture as well as works that draw on contemporary inspirations, including the movie Godzilla.
artist_info:
Estela Dagua (also known as Jacinta Esthela Dagua Malaber
Canelos Quichua, 1951–?)
Puyo, Pastaza Province, Ecuador
title: Jaguar Head
